channel.title: Wireless on DistributedFog
channel.description: Recent content in Wireless on DistributedFog

item.title: LoRaWAN
item.description: LoRaWAN is a Low Power Wide Area Network (LPWAN) specification intended for wireless battery operated Things in a regional, national or global network. It is designed to allow low-powered devices to communicate with Internet-connected applications over long range wireless connections. lora-alliance.org The Things Network The Things Network is a first-of-its-kind system that uses low-power, low-bandwidth LoRaWAN technology to cover the city with a wireless signal that allows objects like boats, trash cans and street lights to become tools for developers.

item.title: WiMAX
item.description: WiMAX is a family of wireless communication standards based on the IEEE 802.16 set of standards, which provide multiple physical layer (PHY) and Media Access Control (MAC) options. It can enable wireless usage at long distances. Wikipedia Possible Uses Portable mobile broadband connectivity across cities Wireless alternative to cable and DSL for “last mile” broadband Data, telecommunications (VoIP) and IPTV services (triple play)

item.title: Wireless Charging
item.description:
Wireless Charging provides a convenient, safe, and reliable way to charge and power electrical devices, IoT sensors and devices, at home, in the workplace and in industry. powerbyproxi.com Research Comparing WiTricity and Inductive Coupling History and Future of Wireless Charging, Transport: Inductive Charging for EVs
Although inductive charging with an induction coil is the most common form of wireless charging, uBeam is pioneering an ultrasound method, HumaVox uses near-field radio frequency resonance and WiTricity uses Magnetic Resonance.
